tournament.name: Manila Duel Commander November 2012 (Quezon City, Philippines)

decks.notes: The deck revolves around using Maelstrom Wanderer as the commander to generate value and control the game through powerful creatures and spells. The deck includes a variety of ramp spells like Cultivate and Kodama's Reach to quickly ramp up mana and cast high-cost creatures like Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan. Control elements like Cryptic Command and Jace, the Mind Sculptor help manage the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes powerful win conditions such as Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Tooth and Nail to assemble game-winning combos. With a focus on ramp, control, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to out-value opponents and take control of the game.

The deck is designed to control the game by utilizing powerful enchantments and disruptive spells to hinder the opponent's strategy. It aims to establish board presence through enchanting Zur the Enchanter with auras like Steel of the Godhead and Prison Term, while also utilizing cards like Solitary Confinement and Oblivion Ring to protect itself. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells and removal spells to deal with threats efficiently. Additionally, it features card advantage engines like Phyrexian Arena and Liliana of the Veil to maintain a steady flow of resources. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells while also including utility lands for added strategic options.

The main focus of the deck is to control the game through countering spells and manipulating time. Jhoira of the Ghitu is used as the commander to enable casting powerful spells for a reduced cost by suspending them. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Balefire Dragon and Eldrazi titans, as well as a variety of instant and sorcery spells for control and card draw. The land base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck and includes utility lands like Wasteland and Tectonic Edge. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for a powerful late-game win condition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various removal spells, discard effects, and powerful board wipes. Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon serves as the commander, providing a strong win condition with its infect ability. The deck also includes a variety of tutoring spells to find key pieces and ensure consistency in drawing into answers. The mana base is designed to support the control elements, with cards like Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth providing crucial ramp and fixing. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan, removing threats efficiently, and eventually closing out the game with infect damage from Skithiryx.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game using a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to prevent the opponent from establishing a strong board presence. The deck aims to protect its commander, Geist of Saint Traft, while setting up powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte to close out the game quickly. It also includes a versatile suite of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Elspeth, Knight-Errant to provide additional card advantage and threats. The deck's extensive mana base allows for consistency and flexibility in casting spells while also providing options for utility lands to further control the game.

The deck revolves around using Mayael the Anima's ability to cheat out powerful creatures from the library with a power of 5 or greater. By ramping up mana with various spells and mana rocks, the deck aims to consistently activate Mayael's ability to put massive threats onto the battlefield. The win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of high-value creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, Avacyn, Angel of Hope, and Terastodon. The deck also includes cards like Worldly Tutor and Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures, along with support cards like Sylvan Library and Greater Good to draw more cards and maintain advantage. By combining ramp, tutoring, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to outvalue and overpower opponents in a Duel Commander format.

This deck focuses on using Sigarda, Host of Herons as the commander to lead an aggro strategy. The key idea is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures and equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine to deal damage to the opponent quickly. In addition, the deck includes a variety of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Wrath of God to control the board and protect Sigarda. The deck also features a strong ramp package with cards like Cultivate and Llanowar Elves to help accelerate the mana curve. Overall, the main goal of this deck is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game swiftly.

This deck focuses on utilizing Talrand, Sky Summoner's ability to generate a constant stream of flying tokens while controlling the game through a myriad of instant spells. The deck is packed with a wide range of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw to consistently disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain card advantage. By efficiently countering threats and bouncing key permanents, the deck aims to stall the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of drakes generated by Talrand. The goal is to control the pace of the game, outvalue the opponent, and ultimately win through a combination of creature beats and spell-based disruption.
